faqs.question: How do I measure my window for the right fit?
faqs.answer: Measure the width and height of your window opening in inches. For inside mount, measure the exact opening. For outside mount, add 2-3 inches on each side for optimal coverage and light blockage.

faqs.question: Are the blinds easy to install?
faqs.answer: Yes! All our blinds come with easy-to-follow installation instructions and mounting hardware. Most customers complete installation in 15-30 minutes per window.

faqs.question: What is your return policy?
faqs.answer: We offer a 30-day satisfaction guarantee on all products. If you're not completely satisfied, you can return unused items in original packaging for a full refund.

blogPosts.title: How to Measure Your Windows for Perfect Fit Blinds
blogPosts.content:
Getting the Perfect Measurements

Measuring your windows correctly is the most important step when ordering custom blinds. Follow these simple steps to ensure a perfect fit every time.

Step 1: Gather Your Tools

You'll need a metal measuring tape (cloth tapes can stretch), a pencil, and paper to record your measurements.

Step 2: Measure Width

For inside mount, measure the width at the top, middle, and bottom of the window opening. Use the smallest measurement.

Step 3: Measure Height

Measure from the top of the opening to the window sill. Take measurements on both sides and in the center, using the longest measurement.
blogPosts.excerpt: Learn the proper techniques for measuring your windows to ensure your custom blinds fit perfectly every time.
blogPosts.author: Admin
blogPosts.seoTitle: How to Measure Windows for Blinds | Complete Guide
blogPosts.seoDescription: Step-by-step guide to measuring your windows for custom blinds. Get perfect measurements every time with our expert tips.

blogPosts.title: Top 5 Window Treatment Trends for 2025
blogPosts.content:
What's Trending in Window Treatments

As we enter 2025, homeowners are embracing new styles and technologies in window treatments. Here are the top trends to watch.

1. Smart Motorized Blinds

Voice-controlled and app-enabled blinds continue to grow in popularity, offering convenience and energy savings.

2. Natural Materials

Bamboo, jute, and other natural woven materials bring organic warmth to any space.

3. Bold Colors

Moving beyond neutrals, bold jewel tones are making a statement in modern homes.

pages.title: About Us
pages.content:
About Peekaboo Shades

We are a family-owned business dedicated to providing high-quality, custom window treatments at affordable prices. Since 2015, we've helped thousands of homeowners transform their spaces with beautiful blinds and shades.

Our Mission

To make custom window treatments accessible to everyone without compromising on quality or style.

Why Choose Us?

  • Factory-direct pricing
  • Premium materials
  • Expert customer service
  • Easy installation

pages.title: Warranty Information
pages.content:
Warranty Information

Standard Warranty

All Peekaboo Shades products come with a comprehensive 1-year warranty covering manufacturing defects and material issues.

Extended Warranty

Upgrade to our 3-year extended warranty at checkout for complete peace of mind. The extended warranty covers:

  • All manufacturing defects
  • Motor and mechanism failures
  • Fabric fading or discoloration
  • Hardware and component issues

How to Make a Claim

Contact our customer service team with your order number and photos of the issue. We'll process your claim within 48 hours.
pages.seoDescription: Learn about our comprehensive warranty coverage for all blinds and shades. 1-year standard, 3-year extended available.

pages.title: Measurement Guide
pages.content:
Window Measurement Guide

Inside Mount

For a clean, built-in look, measure the inside of your window frame:

  1. Measure width at top, middle, and bottom
  2. Use the smallest width measurement
  3. Measure height on left, center, and right
  4. Use the longest height measurement

Outside Mount

For maximum light blockage or to cover window trim:

  1. Decide how much overlap you want (typically 2-3 inches per side)
  2. Add the overlap to your window width
  3. Measure from where you want the top to the sill
pages.seoTitle: Window Measurement Guide | How to Measure for Blinds
pages.seoDescription: Complete guide to measuring your windows for inside and outside mount blinds. Get the perfect fit every time.
